result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Boucher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed. 

No violent/abusive contact with K.M.G.

Sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program. 

AODA and follow through with recommendations. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rule violations.
I/S to be used for rule violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Boucher

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Nicole.
Case called: 1:22 p.m.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall and Probation Agent; Defendant appears via Zoom.
(Probation Review Hearing)

COURT questions defendant if he/she has received a copy of the probation review.
COURT reviews progress with Deft. 

DATES:
PRH: 12/16/22 @ 1:15 p.m.

Adj: 1:23 p.m.
Probation review hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:10 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person, pro se. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no violent/abusive contact with KMG; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) and DA surcharge; 30 days MCJ & 40 hours CS imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 5 days jail credit if revoked. 
Probation Review Hrg set for 10/21/2022 at 1:15 pm. 
Adj: 10:19 am

Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Final pre-trial on August 19, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Jury status hearing on September 7, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Jury Trial on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A. Boucher
Current: 119316 Logger St., Stratford, WI 54484 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2022)
Prior: 208 S Palmetto Avenue, Marshfield, WI 54449

No contact with victim(s): K.M.G.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retreive personal property from the residence (Stratford PD or Marathon County Sheriff).     No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:42 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Greg Venturini, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CMs

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): K.M.G. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Stratford PD or Marathon CO Sherriff). 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
